term_definitions.items: To record the result of a laboratory test which may be used to record a single valued test but will often be specialised or templated to represent multiple value or 'panel' tests. This archetype also acts as the parent for specialisations appropriate for more specific laboratory tests microbiology, histopathology.
The proportion of haemaglobin in the blood that is glycosylated.

Specific identifier for this lab test. e.g. Full blood count , blood glucose, urine microbiology. May equate to the result name for a single value result. Commonly a coded term e.g from LOINC or SNOMED-CT.
Representations of the whole test in mutlimedia e.g image, audio, video.
Demographic details of the laboratory with responsibility for the test. Details of secondary laboratories may also be included.
This is an initial or interim result - further updates are anticipated
This is the final result. No further alterations are anticipated
This is a supplememtary result in addition to the Interim result
This is a Correction which should replace any previous results
An overall interpretative comment on this test.
The local ID assigned to the order by the order requester. Equivalent to the Placer Order Identifier.
The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the (LIS) Laboratory Information System. Equivalent to the DICOM Accession Number and the Filler Order Identifier.
Details of the specimen being reported where all individual results are derived from the same specimen
The identifier given to the laboratory test result of a pathology investigation.
The status of the lab test as a whole.
The date and time related to the results status is useful for version control and cumulative results for the report.
The date and/or time that the result was issued for the recorded ‘test status’.
The type of high-level diagnostic service e.g. biochemistry, haematology.
Slot to allow an annotation to be added to a particular test result at run-time.
Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test.
The temperature was measured at the buccal mucosa.
The temperature was measured at the sub-lingual mucosa.
Evidence of chills / rigor or shivering.
A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the whole body temperature of the person.
A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the whole body temperature of the person.
The measured body temperature (as a surrogate for the whole body)
The anatomical site of measurement of the temperature
The anatomical site of measurement of the temperature.
Temperature is measured within the mouth
Temperature is measured from within the external auditory canal
Temperature is measured from the skin of the axilla with the arm positioned down by the side
Temperature is measured within the nasopharynx
Temperature is measured in the urinary bladder
Temperature is measured within the vascular system
The thermal situation of the person who is having the temperature taken
The person is covered by a lesser amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances
The person is covered by an amount of clothing or bedding deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances
The person is covered by an increased amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances
Description of the conditions applied to the subject that might influence their measured body temperature.
Temperature is measured from exposed skin
Temperature is measured within the vagina
Temperatue is measured within the oesophagus
Temperature is measured in the inguinal skin crease between the leg and abdominal wall
Details about the environmental conditions at the time of temperature measurement
Details about the exertion of the person at the time of temperature measurement
Details about the menstrual cycle of a woman
Details about the device use to measure body temperature
Acts as a container for a set of archetype which represent a single date-capture screen.
Generic encounter or progress note composition

items.items: Generic encounter or progress note composition
Acts as a container for a set of archetype which represent a single date-capture screen.
